stand_out:
* Make your app more delightful with material design patterns such as **shared element transitions** across activities and **parallax scrolling** where two or more items must scroll in the same activity.
* Implement **notifications** in your app. Remember the following when implementing notifications:
    * Notifications should not contain advertising or content unrelated to the core function of the app.
    * Notifications should be persistent only if related to ongoing events (such as music playback or a phone call).
    * Multiple notifications are stacked into a single notification object, where possible.
    * Use notifications only to indicate a context change relating to the user personally (such as an incoming message).
    * Use notifications only to expose information/controls relating to an ongoing event (such as music playback or a phone call).
* Implement **sharing** functionality in your app, making use of intent extras to share rich content (i.e. a paragraph of content-specific text, a link and description, an image, etc).
* Create and use a **custom view** in your app that could not be achieved with the standard widgets provided by the core views on Android.

rubric_items.passed_description: App conforms to common standards found in the [Android Nanodegree General Project Guidelines](http://udacity.github.io/android-nanodegree-guidelines/core.html)
rubric_items.criteria: App conforms to common standards found in the [Android Nanodegree General Project Guidelines](http://udacity.github.io/android-nanodegree-guidelines/core.html)

rubric_items.passed_description: App is written solely in the Java Programming Language
rubric_items.criteria: App is written solely in the Java Programming Language

rubric_items.passed_description: App utilizes stable release versions of all libraries, Gradle, and Android Studio.
rubric_items.criteria: Submission must use stable release versions of all libraries, Gradle, and Android Studio. Debug/beta/canary versions are not acceptable.

rubric_items.passed_description: App integrates a third-party library.
rubric_items.criteria: App integrates a third-party library.

rubric_items.passed_description: App validates all input from servers and users. If data does not exist or is in the wrong format, the app logs this fact and does not crash.
rubric_items.criteria: App validates all input from servers and users. If data does not exist or is in the wrong format, the app logs this fact and does not crash.

rubric_items.passed_description: App includes support for accessibility. That includes content descriptions, navigation using a D-pad, and, if applicable, non-audio versions of audio cues.
rubric_items.criteria: App includes support for accessibility. That includes content descriptions, navigation using a D-pad, and, if applicable, non-audio versions of audio cues.

rubric_items.passed_description: App keeps all strings in a `strings.xml` file and enables RTL layout switching on all layouts.
rubric_items.criteria: App keeps all strings in a strings.xml file and enables RTL layout switching on all layouts.

rubric_items.passed_description: App provides a widget to provide relevant information to the user on the home screen.
rubric_items.criteria: App provides a widget to provide relevant information to the user on the home screen.

rubric_items.passed_description: App integrates two or more Google services. Google service integrations can be a part of Google Play Services or Firebase.
rubric_items.criteria: App integrates two or more Google services

rubric_items.passed_description: Each service imported in the `build.gradle` is used in the app.
rubric_items.criteria: Each service imported in the `build.gradle` is used in the app.

rubric_items.passed_description: If `Location` is used, the app customizes the user’s experience by using the device's location.
rubric_items.criteria: If `Location` is used, the app customizes the user’s experience by using the device's location.

rubric_items.passed_description: If `Admob` is used, the app displays test ads. If `Admob` was not used, student meets specifications.
rubric_items.criteria: If `Admob` is used, the app displays test ads. If `admob` was not used, student meets specifications.

rubric_items.passed_description: If `Analytics` is used, the app creates only one analytics instance. If `Analytics` was not used, student meets specifications.
rubric_items.criteria: If Analytics is used, the app creates only one analytics instance. If analytics was not used, student meets specifications.

rubric_items.passed_description: If `Maps` is used, the map provides relevant information to the user. If `Maps` was not used, student meets specifications.
rubric_items.criteria: If Maps is used, the map provides relevant information to the user. If maps was not used, student meets specifications.

rubric_items.passed_description: If `Identity` is used, the user’s identity influences some portion of the app. If `Identity` was not used, student meets specifications.
rubric_items.criteria: If Identity is used, the user’s identity influences some portion of the app. If identity was not used, student meets specifications.

rubric_items.passed_description: App theme extends `AppCompat`.
rubric_items.criteria: App theme extends AppCompat.

rubric_items.passed_description: App uses an app bar and associated toolbars.
rubric_items.criteria: App uses an app bar and associated toolbars.

rubric_items.passed_description: App uses standard and simple transitions between activities.
rubric_items.criteria: App uses standard and simple transitions between activities.

rubric_items.passed_description: App builds from a clean repository checkout with no additional configuration.
rubric_items.criteria: App builds from a clean repository checkout with no additional configuration.

rubric_items.passed_description: App is equipped with a signing configuration, and the keystore and passwords are included in the repository. Keystore is referred to by a relative path.
rubric_items.criteria: App is equipped with a signing configuration, and the keystore and passwords are included in the repository. Keystore is referred to by a relative path.

rubric_items.passed_description: App builds and deploys using the `installRelease` `Gradle` task.
rubric_items.criteria: App builds and deploys using the `installRelease` `Gradle` task.

rubric_items.passed_description: All app dependencies are managed by `Gradle`.
rubric_items.criteria: All app dependencies are managed by `Gradle`.

rubric_items.passed_description: App stores data locally using Room OR Firebase Realtime Database. No third party frameworks may be used.
rubric_items.criteria: App stores data locally using Room OR Firebase Realtime Database. No third party frameworks may be used.

rubric_items.passed_description:
Must implement at least **one** of the three
If it regularly pulls or sends data to/from a web service or API, app updates data in its cache at regular intervals using a SyncAdapter or JobDispacter.
**OR**
If it needs to pull or send data to/from a web service or API only once, or on a per request basis (such as a search application), app uses an IntentService to do so.
**OR**
It it performs short duration, on-demand requests(such as search), app uses an AsyncTask.
rubric_items.criteria:
Must implement at least **one** of the three
If it regularly pulls or sends data to/from a web service or API, app updates data in its cache at regular intervals using a SyncAdapter or JobDispacter.
**OR**
If it needs to pull or send data to/from a web service or API only once, or on a per request basis (such as a search application), app uses an IntentService to do so.
**OR**
It it performs short duration, on-demand requests(such as search), app uses an AsyncTask.

rubric_items.passed_description: If Room is used then LiveData and ViewModel are used when required and no unnecessary calls to the database are made.
rubric_items.criteria: If Room is used then LiveData and ViewModel are used when required and no unnecessary calls to the database are made.
